disease: Bone and joint lesions of yaws

symptoms.name: Pain and swelling of long bones and fingers
symptoms.pattern: Occurs in secondary yaws, weeks to months after primary infection

physical_findings: Multiple raised yellow lesions in secondary yaws

lab_values.Treponema pallidum particle agglutinatio: Positive in treponemal infections, cannot distinguish yaws from syphilis
lab_values.Rapid plasma reagin (RPR): Positive in treponemal infections, cannot distinguish yaws from syphilis
lab_values.Polymerase chain reaction (PCR): Detects T. pallidum subspecies pertenue DNA in skin lesions, confirms diagnosis and monitors azithromycin resistance

risk_factors: Living in warm, humid, tropical forest areas

required: Clinical presentation (papilloma or ulcer in primary yaws, multiple lesions in secondary yaws)
Positive serological test (TPPA or RPR), confirmed by PCR

differential_diagnoses: Other skin ulcers (e.g., caused by Haemophilus ducreyi)
